title: I live on social security disability, am i judgement proof?
question: I have under 10,000. dollars of outstanding credit card debt. I am now permantly disabled and am unable to make any payments. Am i judgement proof? Being unable to pay, what will that do to my credit?
answers:
As the other attorney said, your Social Security check is judgment proof. However, the creditor can try to garnish your checking account and go after any othe assets you may have. Thus, you may want to speak to a bankruptcy attorney in your state.

THESE COMMENTS ARE NOT LEGAL ADVICE. They are provided for informational purposes only. Actual legal advice can only be provided after consultation by an attorney licensed in your jurisdiction. Answering this question does not create an attorney-client relationship or otherwise require further consultation.

Being unable to pay will hurt your credit. the credit card company will charge off theloan on your credit report and collections will start.

Social Security payments are exempt from attachment but whether or not you have other assets will determine if you are judgment proof. The question cannot be answered without knowing what other assets you have or what other sources of income you may have now and in the future.
